humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the greatest dimension of the invasive component of the tumor is 7.5 cm, which falls under the T3 category of tumors that are more than 5 cm in size. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive lobular carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Tumor size is used to determine the T stage, even when the histological type is Medullary Adenocarcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is primarily based on the size of the tumor. In this report, the greatest dimension of the tumor is measured to be 7.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T stage of T3 is assigned to tumors that are greater than 5 cm in size but not more than 10 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
